text: Naomi Harriet Ward Randall (October 5, 1908 – May 17, 2001) was a Latter-day Saint songwriter and author and a leader in the Primary of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church). In 1957, Randall wrote the lyrics to "I Am a Child of God", an LDS Church hymn that was originally written as a song for children. Randall served as a member of the general board of the Primary Association for 27 years. As a member of the board, she was asked to write a song for children that would teach them the LDS Church beliefs on the nature of a child's relationship with God. The result was "I Am a Child of God", which has been published in over 90 languages.Abbey Olsen, “Beloved Song Turns 50,” Liahona, January 2007. Randall also wrote the lyrics to "When Faith Endures", which is hymn #128 in the LDS Church hymnal. Randall was a frequent contributor to The Children's Friend and was the chair of the Primary committee that created the CTR ring. From 1970 and 1974, Randall was the first counselor to LaVern W. Parmley in the general presidency of the Primary. On October 13, 1998, Randall was awarded a Presidential Citation by Brigham Young University president Merrill J. Bateman for her lifelong service to the children of the LDS Church."'I Am a Child of God' Lyricist Honored", BYU Magazine, Winter 1998. Naomi Harriet Ward was born in North Ogden, Utah. She was married to Earl A. Randall and was the mother of one child. Naomi Randall died due to advanced age in La Mesa, California. == Notes == {| |- | |- | |} Category:American Latter Day Saint hymnwriters Category:American Latter Day Saint writers Category:Counselors in the General Presidency of the Primary (LDS Church) Category:Writers from Ogden, Utah Category:1908 births Category:2001 deaths Category:American leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints Category:American female songwriters Category:20th- century American musicians Category:Songwriters from Utah Category:20th- century American women musicians Category:Women hymnwriters Category:Latter Day Saints from Utah Category:Latter Day Saints from California Category:People from North Ogden, Utah Category:American women non-fiction writers
